name: format string
desc: The format_string module provides a simple means to convert values coming from various numeric and string input ports into a resultant string.

properties.name: Expression
properties.desc: The Expression allows the user to control the sequence of Variables used to create the output string.

properties.name: Date Format
properties.desc: The Date Format allows the user to control how Date values will be displayed in the output string.

properties.name: Scale
properties.desc: Scale is the  scaling factor for vertical (z) coordinates.  This value reflects a multiplication factor of the layer thickness. For example, a layer that is 10 feet thick that is subjected to a z- exaggeration value of 4, will appear 40 feet thick in the viewer.

properties.name: N1
properties.desc: The N1 field is a double value that can be used as the variable {N1} in the expression.

properties.name: N2
properties.desc: The N2 field is a double value that can be used as the variable {N2} in the expression.

properties.name: N3
properties.desc: The N3 field is a double value that can be used as the variable {N3} in the expression.

properties.name: N4
properties.desc: The N4 field is a double value that can be used as the variable {N4} in the expression.

properties.name: S1
properties.desc: The S1 field is a string value that can be used as the variable {S1} in the expression.

properties.name: S2
properties.desc: The S2 field is a string value that can be used as the variable {S2} in the expression.

properties.name: S3
properties.desc: The S3 field is a string value that can be used as the variable {S3} in the expression.

properties.name: Date
properties.desc: The Date field is a date value that can be used as the variable {Date} in the expression.

properties.name: Result
properties.desc: The Result is the output string created by resolving the Expression.
